Dimensions:
Plate: 3 9/16 x 3 7/8 inches (9 x 9.8 cm)
Sheet: 4 5/16 x 4 15/16 inches (11 x 12.6 cm)
CreditLine: The Muriel and Philip Berman Gift, acquired from the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, with funds contributed by Muriel and Philip Berman, gifts (by exchange) of Lisa Norris Elkins, Bryant W. Langston, Samuel S. White 3rd and Vera White, with additional funds contributed by John Howard McFadden, Jr., Thomas Skelton Harrison, and the Philip H. and A.S.W. Rosenbach Foundation
Title: A Resting Sheep Bothered by Flies
Geography: Made in Düsseldorf, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, Europe
Artist: Wilhelm von Abbema, German, 1812 - 1889. Copy in reverser after an etching of 1655 by Karel Dujardin, Dutch (active Amsterdam and Italy), 1626 - 1678.
Titles: A Resting Sheep Bothered by Flies
